snippet: The “urgent mission” by Pierre Krähenbühl was intended to call attention to what is seen as impending calamity at the Yarmouk camp, where some 18,000 Palestinian and Syrian civilians are trapped.
abstract: Pierre Krahenbuhl, commissioner general of United Nations Relief and Works Agency, visits Syria to help prevent humanitarian calamity at Yarmouk refugee camp near Damascus, where 18,000 Palestinian and Syrian civilians are trapped; area was seized by Islamic State militants, and Syrian government has been contesting control of area.
lead_paragraph: The “urgent mission” by Pierre Krähenbühl was intended to call attention to what is seen as impending calamity at the Yarmouk camp, where some 18,000 Palestinian and Syrian civilians are trapped.

headline.main: U.N. Official Visits Syria to Press Urgency of Besieged Refuge Camp
headline.print_headline: U.N. Official Visits Syria to Press Case of Refugee Camp

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
